translated: The Group of Three Collections🔽The Chapter with Udapāna
The Jātaka of the Polluter of the Watering Place
“The sage who lives in the wilderness,
who has practiced for a long time,
the watering place that he has made with difficulty,
how did you, good sir, make it overflow?”

analyzed: esa dhammo siṅgālāna  yam pitvā ohadāmase
translated: “This is the way of jackals,🔽that after eating they lie down;
the way of grandfathers and grandfathers’ fathers,
“For those whose way is like this,
either your dhamma or your adhamma.”
The Jātaka of the Polluter of the Watering Place, the first.
